intro: Mesosetum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and sturdy, upright growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils, often found in swampy areas and along riverbanks. Its flowering stems produce dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Mesosetum latifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
